channel.title: [LINUX] Help installing JDK on Linux
channel.description:
Well, I am getting an error when I try to install JDK with the binary I downloaded. My distro is Ubuntu.
Here is my error: [code] Unpacking... Checksumming... Extracting... ./install.sfx.29337: 1: ELF: not found ./install.sfx.29337: 2: Syntax error: ")" unexpected Failed to extract the files. Please refer to the Troubleshooting section of the Installation Instructions on the download page for more information. cricket@ubuntu:~$ [/code]
I looked on the Java FAQ on Downloading/installing and I did not find anything regarding my issue.
Copied right from the Terminal after trying to do [b]sh jdk-6u14-linux-x64.bin[/b]. Please help, I don't want to have to go back to my Windows OS :(

item.title: [LINUX] Help installing JDK on Linux
item.dc:creator: @CAPT_AMERIKA AMERIKA
item.description:
@CAPT_AMERIKA wrote:

Well, I am getting an error when I try to install JDK with the binary I downloaded. My distro is Ubuntu.

Here is my error:

Unpacking...
Checksumming...
Extracting...
./install.sfx.29337: 1: ELF: not found
./install.sfx.29337: 2: Syntax error: ")" unexpected
Failed to extract the files.  Please refer to the Troubleshooting section of
the Installation Instructions on the download page for more information.
cricket@ubuntu:~$

I looked on the Java FAQ on Downloading/installing and I did not find anything regarding my issue.

Copied right from the Terminal after trying to do sh jdk-6u14-linux-x64.bin. Please help, I donâ€™t want to have to go back to my Windows OS
